info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 9 at 8:27PM EDT until September 9 at 10:30PM EDT by NWS Melbourne FL
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central Florida, including the following county, Volusia.
* WHEN...Until 1030 PM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 827 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Daytona Beach, Port Orange, Ormond Beach, South Daytona, Holly Hill, Ormond-By-the-Sea, Daytona Beach Shores, Daytona International Speedway, Daytona Beach Airport, Ponce Inlet, Ormond Beach Airport, Allandale, Wilbur By The Sea, Harbor Oaks and Samsula-Spruce Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM EDT THIS EVENING
